name: prediction
title: Prediction API
description: Lets you access a cloud hosted machine learning service that makes it easy to build smart apps

parameters.name: key
parameters.desc: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.desc: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.desc: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.desc: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

parameters.name: userIp
parameters.desc: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.desc: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

fields.name: classLabel
fields.desc: The true class label of this instance

fields.name: csvInstance
fields.desc: The input features for this instance

fields.name: input
fields.desc: Input to the model for a prediction

fields.name: csvInstance
fields.desc: A list of input features, these can be strings or doubles.

fields.name: outputValue
fields.desc: The estimated regression value [Regression models only].

fields.name: selfLink
fields.desc: A URL to re-request this resource.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The unique name for the predictive model.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: What kind of resource this is.

fields.name: outputLabel
fields.desc: The most likely class [Categorical models only].

fields.name: outputMulti
fields.desc: A list of classes with their estimated probabilities [Categorical models only].

fields.name: label
fields.desc: The class label.

fields.name: score
fields.desc: The probability of the class.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The unique name for the predictive model.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: What kind of resource this is.

fields.name: modelInfo
fields.desc: Model metadata.

fields.name: numberClasses
fields.desc: Number of classes in the trained model [Categorical models only].

fields.name: numberInstances
fields.desc: Number of valid data instances used in the trained model.

fields.name: classWeightedAccuracy
fields.desc: Estimated accuracy of model taking utility weights into account [Categorical models only].

fields.name: classificationAccuracy
fields.desc: A number between 0.0 and 1.0, where 1.0 is 100% accurate. This is an estimate, based on the amount and quality of the training data, of the estimated prediction accuracy. You can use this is a guide to decide whether the results are accurate enough for your needs. This estimate will be more reliable if your real input data is similar to your training data [Categorical models only].

fields.name: confusionMatrix
fields.desc: An output confusion matrix. This shows an estimate for how this model will do in predictions. This is first indexed by the true class label. For each true class label, this provides a pair {predicted_label, count}, where count is the estimated number of times the model will predict the predicted label given the true label. Will not output if more then 100 classes [Categorical models only].

fields.name: confusionMatrixRowTotals
fields.desc: A list of the confusion matrix row totals

fields.name: meanSquaredError
fields.desc: An estimated mean squared error. The can be used to measure the quality of the predicted model [Regression models only].

fields.name: modelType
fields.desc: Type of predictive model (CLASSIFICATION or REGRESSION)

fields.name: selfLink
fields.desc: A URL to re-request this resource.

fields.name: trainingStatus
fields.desc: The current status of the training job. This can be one of following: RUNNING; DONE; ERROR; ERROR: TRAINING JOB NOT FOUND

fields.name: utility
fields.desc: A class weighting function, which allows the importance weights for classes to be specified [Categorical models only].

methods.name: predict
methods.desc: Submit input and request an output against a hosted model

pathParams.name: hostedModelName
pathParams.desc: The name of a hosted model

methods.name: predict
methods.desc: Submit data and request a prediction

methods.name: update
methods.desc: Add new data to a trained model

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Check training status of your model
